content.user_title: Optimize application performance across the stack
content.value_statement: Slow applications frustrate users and hurt business metrics. This skill provides proven patterns and templates to diagnose bottlenecks, implement caching strategies, and achieve optimal performance across frontend, backend, and database layers.
actual_capabilities: Diagnose performance bottlenecks across database, API, and frontend layers
Implement cache-aside patterns with Redis and in-memory memoization
Optimize database queries including N+1 fixes and cursor pagination
Configure Prometheus metrics for performance monitoring
Apply React optimization patterns including virtualization and memoization
Set performance budgets and Core Web Vitals targets
limitations: Does not execute code or make changes to user projects automatically
Requires user to apply suggested optimizations manually
Does not access external monitoring services or APIs
Templates are examples that need adaptation to specific codebases

use_cases.title: Optimize database queries
use_cases.description: Fix slow queries, implement connection pooling, and add proper indexing

use_cases.title: Improve page load speed
use_cases.description: Reduce bundle size, implement code splitting, and optimize Core Web Vitals

use_cases.title: Build caching strategy
use_cases.description: Design multi-tier caching with Redis, memoization, and CDN integration

prompt_templates.title: Database Performance Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the following database queries for performance issues. Identify N+1 patterns, missing indexes, and slow queries. Suggest optimizations with SQL examples.

prompt_templates.title: API Response Time
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this API endpoint code. Suggest optimizations including compression, ETags, field selection, and pagination improvements.

prompt_templates.title: Frontend Bundle Size
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this frontend codebase. Recommend code splitting strategies, tree shaking improvements, and lazy loading patterns to reduce bundle size.

prompt_templates.title: Performance Budget
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a performance budget for a React application. Include targets for Core Web Vitals, bundle sizes, and API response times.

output_examples.input: Optimize this slow API endpoint that fetches user data with orders
output: 1. N+1 Query Issue: Found 1 query for users + N queries for orders
2. Fix: Use JOIN or include pattern to fetch all data in single query
3. Add caching: Implement cache-aside with 1-hour TTL for user data
4. Response optimization: Add ETag support for conditional requests
5. Compression: Enable gzip for responses over 1KB
6. Field selection: Allow clients to request only needed fields

best_practices: Profile before optimizing to identify actual bottlenecks rather than assumed issues
Set measurable performance targets and budgets before making changes
Use cursor pagination instead of offset-based pagination for large datasets
anti_patterns: Premature optimization without measurement wastes development time
Loading all records into memory instead of using pagination
Skipping cache invalidation strategies leads to stale data issues

faq.question: Which tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Templates use TypeScript patterns applicable to any JavaScript runtime.

faq.question: What performance targets should I aim for?
faq.answer: Target LCP under 2.5s, INP under 200ms, and API responses under 100ms for simple reads.

faq.question: How do I measure frontend performance?
faq.answer: Use Lighthouse CI in your pipeline, Chrome DevTools Performance tab, and track Core Web Vitals with RUM.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill contains only documentation and templates. It never accesses files, networks, or executes code on your system.

faq.question: Why are my database queries still slow after adding indexes?
faq.answer: Check query patterns. Avoid SELECT *, use covered indexes, and verify with EXPLAIN ANALYZE that Index Scans are used.

faq.question: How is this different from other optimization tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides patterns and guidance rather than automated tools. It helps you understand and implement optimizations correctly.
